title: SL woman trying to smuggle in Rs.4.9 Mn worth cigarettes nabbed at BIA
byline: A Sri Lankan woman trying to smuggle in foreign cigarettes worth Rs.4.9 million concealed in her baggage was arrested by the Police at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning.

title: Ex-Malaysian Premier Mahathir hospitalized due to fatigue days after 100th birthday
byline: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad was hospitalized due to fatigue, his office announced on Sunday, just days after his 100th birthday on Thursday.

title: Wimal Weerawansa alleges e-NIC tender handed over to Indian firm, Raising data security concerns
byline: National Freedom Front (NFF) leader Wimal Weerawansa has alleged that the ‘Punarudaya’ government has handed over the tender to develop Sri Lanka’s electronic National Identity Card (e-NIC) system to an Indian non-profit company, raising serious concerns over national data security.

title: CBSL to launch ‘Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week’ tomorrow
byline: The Financial Consumer Relations Department of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) will launch the ‘Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week’ from July 14 to July 18, 2025 under the

title: ‘I am free from today’: Assam man celebrates divorce by bathing in 40 litres of milk
byline: “I am free from today,” said Manik Ali as he bizarrely celebrated his divorce, now a viral moment on the Internet. Ali bathed in 40 litres of milk and announced that he was free from his wife, who allegedly eloped with her lover twice.

title: Two killed in motorcycle-bus collision
byline: Two men were killed when a motorcycle collided head-on against a private bus at Mallehewa on the Meerigama-Pasyala main road this morning.

title: UNDP to support in building effective public service
byline: The Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Azusa Kubota affirmed that the UNDP will support the Sri Lankan government’s ongoing initiatives

title: Piyumi Hansamali’s son arrested over assault in Rajagiriya
byline: The Welikada Police have arrested the son of popular model Piyumi Hansamali over an assault incident reported in the Kalapaluwawa area of Rajagiriya.

title: US drops charges against doctor accused of destroying Covid vaccines
byline: The US attorney general has ordered charges to be dropped against a doctor accused of destroying Covid-19 vaccines worth $28,000 (£20,742), distributing fake vaccination record cards, and giving children saline shots instead of the vaccine at their parents’ request.

title: Mother of Ishara Sewwandi dies in custody
byline: The mother of Ishara Sewwandi, the main suspect in the murder of Ganemulla Sanjeewa, has died while in remand custody at Welikada Prison.

title: Fire destroys tourist resort under construction in Ella
byline: A tourist resort under construction in the Kandekumbura area in Ella was destroyed by a fire, police said.

title: Worker remittances rise 22% in June
byline: Sri Lankans working overseas sent home USD 635.7 million in remittances during June 2025, according to data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

title: EU and Mexico criticise Trump’s proposed 30% tariff
byline: The European Union (EU) and Mexico have expressed disappointment at US President Donald Trump’s threat to impose 30% tariffs on their imports from 1 August.

title: Private airline takes Karachi-bound passenger to Jeddah
byline: A private airline has come under scrutiny after a passenger bound for Karachi from Lahore was mistakenly flown to Jeddah without passport and visa, ARY News reported.

title: Sri Lanka, China reaffirm strategic partnership at ASEAN meeting
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, met with Chinese Foreign Minister H.E. Wang Yi on the sidelines of the ASEAN Foreign Ministers’ Meetings in Kuala Lumpur yesterday (12).
